overview: From 2025-12-04 to 2025-12-05, ethereum-optimism/optimism had 12 new PRs (5 merged), 7 new issues, and 32 active contributors.

topIssues.title: op-batcher [altda]: allow configurable frame size, multi-frame-txs
topIssues.author: tuxcanfly
topIssues.body:
<!--
Need help?
Refer to our contributing guidelines for additional information about making a good issue:
https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/.github/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

altda rollups have higher throughput than ethereum but are constrained by channel limits originally set based on ethereum.

**Describe the solution you'd like**

`op-batcher` channel options `MaxFrameSize` and `MultiFrameTxs` should be configurable. Additional sanity checks for frame size should be updated to reference `l.ChannelConfig.TargetNumFrames` instead.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
<!--
A clear and concise description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered.
-->

**Additional context**
<!--
Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here.
-->

Potential fix: https://github.com/celestiaorg/optimism/pull/439

topIssues.title: op-batcher [altda]: handle post-holocene ordering in concurrent mode
topIssues.author: tuxcanfly
topIssues.body:
<!--
Need help?
Refer to our contributing guidelines for additional information about making a good issue:
https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/.github/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

**Bug Description**

`op-batcher` fails to account for ordering when handling concurrent altda requests. This is because of the goroutines spawned by `daGroup.TryGo` in `publishAltDAAndL1`.

**Steps to Reproduce**

1. set `--altda.max-concurrent-da-request > 1`
2. run `op-batcher` against altda server
3. L1 commitments are submitted in order of latency

Since out of order frames are dropped post-holocene, this will cause a reorg.

**Expected behavior**

L1 commitments should be submitted in sequential order.

**Environment Information:**
macOS 14.1
op-batcher v1.16.2

**Configurations:**
<!--
Command line flags or environment variables you're using.
-->

**Logs:**
<!--
Logs and/or error messages that help illustrate the issue.
-->

**Additional context**
<!--
Add any other context about the problem here.
-->

Potential fix: https://github.com/nktaushanov/optimism/pull/1

---

⚠️ **Notice:** Issues that do not include the following sections will be subject to closure:
- Bug Description
- Steps to Reproduce
- Environment Information

Please ensure all required sections are filled out accurately to expedite the debugging process and improve issue resolution efficiency.

topIssues.title: Action test asserting EIP-2935 is used to speed up canonical block queries
topIssues.author: Inphi
topIssues.body:
The interop program depends on EIP-2935 to speed up historical block queries. These queries are made when an executing message references a prior block during the consolidation step.

While the historical query is bounded by the 24 day expiry window, it's still a lot of blocks to sift through to satisfy a query. With EIP-2935, we can drastically reduce the search and ensure that the program execution in the fpvm completes in a reasonable amount of time. The op-program already has unit tests asserting that EIP-2935 is utilized to speed up historical queries, but we lack such coverage for Kona. We should write an action test for this case to cover both.

topIssues.title: kona-sp1: Investigate requirement for L1 head offset beyond batch posting block with safe head > L2 end block.
topIssues.author: Inphi

topIssues.title: Remove `SystemConfig::isCustomGasToken` override allowance for OPCMv2
topIssues.author: 0xiamflux
topIssues.body: OPCMv2 currently has an allowance that permits an override for the value of `SystemConfig::isCustomGasToken`. This is required until U18 ships when `isCustomGasToken` will be available on the SystemConfig and needs to be removed afterward.

topPRs.title: feat: break out OPCMv2 utils into helper contracts
topPRs.author: smartcontracts
topPRs.body: Breaks out the OPCMv2 utils into a separate Utils contract that reduces the code size of OPCMv2 significantly.

topPRs.title: test: use a custom Test contract for makeAddr
topPRs.author: smartcontracts
topPRs.body: This PR introduces a light wrapper around the forge Test contract specifically for the purpose of making sure people are using a version of makeAddr that will always be reproducible. Without this makeAddr uses a private key which means that fork tests can be unreliable if people mess with these addresses on mainnet.

topPRs.title: ci: reduce permissions of fork builds & fix tag releases
topPRs.author: falcorocks
topPRs.body:
## Summary
Split the docker CI workflows following the infra repo pattern:

- **tags.yaml**: handles release tag pushes (GCP registry, attestation)
- **branches.yaml**: handles develop push and PRs with local/fork distinction
  - `local` job: develop push or local branch PRs → GCP registry
  - `fork` job: fork PRs → ttl.sh, minimal permissions

## Dependencies
- Depends on https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/factory/pull/9 (docker-bake fork detection)

## Changes
- Renamed `protected.yaml` → `tags.yaml` (tags only)
- Renamed `unprotected.yaml` → `branches.yaml` (branches + PRs with local/fork split)
- Fork PRs now get reduced permissions and push to ttl.sh
- Local branch PRs now get full permissions and push to GCP registry

topPRs.title: op-node: Light CL: Follow Source using EL or CL
topPRs.author: pcw109550
topPRs.body:
<!--
Contributions welcome! See https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/.github/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

**Description**

Builds on top of https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/18365

This PR enables `--l2.follow.source` to accept either EL or CL as the source. It also prepares the system for ingesting external `CurrentL1` data into the CL. When using a CL RPC endpoint, we can fetch `CurrentL1` directly.

Populating `CurrentL1` is required for the batcher to operate correctly. Without derivation running, the `syncStatus.CurrentL1` field remains empty, which prevents the batcher and potentially other microservices from making progress.


**Tests**

Existing in memory acceptance preset was tweaked to follow the EL and the CL.

Commit https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/18500/commits/7fd3deb26541b475da2820ea8e8c533837774ce4 is running at the devnet.
- Tag: `7fd3deb-light-cl-follow-source-el-cl`.

**Metadata**

- Part of https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/issues/18317
